channel.title: RadioNowhere
channel.description: It's eclectic! It's eccentric! It's RadioNowhere!
channel.itunes:subtitle: RadioNowhere
channel.itunes:summary: It's eclectic! It's eccentric! It's RadioNowhere! RadioNowhere began in 2002 as a reaction to the lack of support commercial radio was giving to unsigned, forgotten and deleted artists. The station now has a devoted following in over 30 countries. Join Bigif, Christopher, Jessica, Jessie, Ley, Patrick, Peta, Piney, Rachel & Ruby as they take you on a musical journey around the world without leaving your easy chair! Enjoy music from such diverse acts as Go-Gos, Allo Darlin', The School, Lush, Gillian Hills, Cashier No. 9, We Are Losers, Hello Moon, Squarehead, The Notas, The Debutantes, September Girls, The #1s, Lords Of The Underground, J. Mascis and The Fog, DJ Zinc, Avi Buffalo, Mr Bloe, David Bowie, Kiss, AC/DC, The Runaways, The Damned, The Wellington International Ukulele Orchestra, The Hunger Mountain Boys, The Lake Country Boys, The Lovely Eggs, Aretha Franklin, The Smiths, Neutron 9000, Sam Cooke, The Seekers, Tom Robinson, The Equals, Ben Charest, Wire, King Tuff, Depeche Mode, The Fascinations, Buffalo Tom, Danny Wilson, Colourbox, The Dream Academy, Buddy Holly, Ritchie Valens, Dean Martin, Lord Kitchener, The Clash, Ann Stephens, Anthony Newley, Warren Zevon, The Mission, Richard Durrant, Kitty Wells, George Jones, Loretta Lynn, Roy Rogers, Sam Sham and the Pharoahs, Violent Femmes, Sophia Loren, The Dinks, Donna Summer, Wallis Bird, Tom Williams and the Boat, Amiina, The War on Drugs, Julie Feeney, Bee Gees, Tennis, Helium, The Railway Children, Magazine, The Apples In Stereo, Demdike Stare, The Lovely Eggs, Dirty Three, Johnny Cash, Mack Self, Merle Haggard, The Everly Brothers, Sammi Smith, Jim Reeves, Kurt Wagner, Harry Gregson-Williams, Adrian Corker, Ray La Montagne, Houses, Wild Nothing, Belle & Sebastian & much much more!!!
channel.itunes:author: RadioNowhere

item.title: Love Action's Friday Fix 1.June.2012
item.description: Jessie offers a monthly early-morning musical groove to give you that Friday feeling and kick start your weekend. This edition features music from The Breeders, Talulah Gosh & Belle & Sebastian.
item.itunes:subtitle: Jessie offers a monthly early-morning musical groove to give you that Friday feeling and kick start your weekend. This edition features music from The Breeders, Talulah Gosh & Belle & Sebastian.
item.itunes:summary:
Love Action's Friday Fix 1.June.2012 www.radionowhere.org
Tweet us! @RadioNowhereUK @jessieluvaction
Here in Ireland and The UK we're finally experiencing the Summer Sun and Bank Holiday BBQs. Fire up the grill, turn the radio up to 11 and Parrrty to this hot Friday Fix! And to our UK listeners, enjoy the Jubilee.
On the show this month: Saints - The Breeders We Want To Parrty Parrty Parrty - Lyn Collins Out On The Floor - Dobie Gray Whay Can't There Be Love? - Dee Edwards The Love I Saw In You Was Just A Mirage - Smokey Robinson & The Miracles Cheap Perfume - Bare Wires Little Miss Keith Richards - John Wesley Coleman Boner Hit - Playlunge Parapets - BOYS This Is It - Obedient Wives Club Be Your Baby - Talulah Gosh Do What I Came To Do - The Fresh & Onlys Solo Amor - Trogons Tin Soldier - The Small Faces Hand of Fate - The Babies Help Me (Get The Feeling) - Ray Sharpe What Kind Of Fool (Did You Think I Am?) - The Tams Legal Man - Belle & Sebastian Summer Holiday - Wild Nothing Endless Spring - Houses
Plus backing music is the soundtrack to the 1965 short film about skateboarders, Skaterdater. Enjoy, and please feel free to send on requests - especially your guilty pleasures - for next month's show to: jessie@radionowhere.org! and of course you can follow me on twitter at twitter.com/jessieluvaction
item.itunes:author: Jessie Ward O'Sullivan
item.itunes:keywords: radio, nowhere, radionowhere, love, action, friday, fix

item.title: The Library Of Sound 16.May.2012
item.description: Join Patrick and Rachel the 3rd Wednesday of each month as they showcase their musical tastes and their inimitable banter. This edition features music by special guest Seamus Fogarty, Interpol & Hannah Cohen.
item.itunes:subtitle: Join Patrick and Rachel the 3rd Wednesday of each month as they showcase their musical tastes and their inimitable banter. This edition features music by special guest Seamus Fogarty, Interpol & Hannah Cohen.
item.itunes:summary:
Library Of Sound 16.May.2012 www.radionowhere.org
Tweet us! @RadioNowhereUK @LibraryOfSound
May's show was a joy to do thanks to Seamus Fogarty agreeing to let us bend his ear at the Camden Crawl 2012. Irish man Seamus was first up during the festival's Fence Collective showcase at the Earl of Camden, which made for a cosy venue for the session that also featured Library favourites such as Kid Canaveral and The Pictish Trail. Mr Fogarty's debut album God Damn You Mountain is a triumph... and a real grower of a vinyl treat. We'd recommend it as an excellent addition to your collection - just £12 and for that you get the vinyl AND CD version. Generous man!
Right, finally.... you've probably been looking for the show's track list.... here we go:
1. Interpol - Untitled 2. Peter Broderick - http://www.itstartshear.com 3. Wolf Alice - Wednesday 4. Seamus Fogarty - Appletrees 5. Johnny Cash - Tennessee Stud 6. Jim O'Rourke - Ghost Ship In A Storm 7. Seamus Fogarty - By The Waterside 8. Hannah Cohen - Don't Say 9. Laura Gibson - Milk-Heavy, Pollen-Eyed 10. Sweet Lights - Are We Gonna Work It Out
item.itunes:author: Rachel Devlin & Patrick Burke

item.title: Filmic 10.May.2012
item.description: Every month Filmic brings you film themes, songs from the movies, incidental tracks, dodgy covers and a few surprises. This edition features music from Ray La Montagne, Bernard Herrmann & Clint Mansell.

item.title: Jessica 6 1.May.2012
item.description: Jessica 6 travels through time the 1st Tuesday of each month. This edition features music from the year 1963 - expect to hear from Gillian Hills, The Beach Boys & The Kingsmen.
item.itunes:subtitle: Jessica 6 travels through time the 1st Tuesday of each month. This edition features music from the year 1963 - expect to hear from Gillian Hills, The Beach Boys & The Kingsmen.

Jessica 6 in 1963 1.May.2012 www.radionowhere.org
Tweet us! @RadioNowhereUK @jessica6uk
Tu Mens - Gillian Hills Featured on her Tu Mens EP Barclay Records
Summer Holiday - Cliff Richard and The Shadows Featured in Summer Holiday film/soundtrack #1 UK singles chart #1 UK album chart Columbia Records (EMI)
Do You Want To Know A Secret - The Beatles Featured on their debut album, Please Please Me #1 UK album chart Parlophone Records US-only single - #2 Billboard Hot 100 Vee-Jay Records
Hey Paula - Paul and Paula #8 UK singles chart #1 US Billboard Hot 100 #1 US Billboard Hot R&B Singles Philips Records
Leavin’ On Your Mind - Patsy Cline #8 US Billboard Hot Country Singles Chart #83 US Billboard Hot 100 Featured on the posthumously-released compilation album The Patsy Cline Story Decca Records
From Russia With Love - Matt Monro Featured in From Russia With Love film/soundtrack United Artists Records #20 UK singles chart Parlophone Records
Wild Is The Wind - Nancy Wilson Featured on her seventh album, Hollywood - My Way Capitol Records
Moon Gas - Dick Hyman and Mary Mayo Featured on their album, Moon Gas MGM Records
In My Room - The Beach Boys #23 US Billboard Hot 100 #209 Rolling Stone’s 500 Greatest Songs of All Time Featured on their third album, Surfer Girl #7 US Billboard 200 #13 UK album chart (1967) Capitol Records
Blowin’ In The Wind - Bob Dylan #2 US Billboard Hot 100 #14 Rolling Stone’s 500 Greatest Songs of All Time Featured on his second album, The Freewheelin’ Bob Dylan #22 US Billboard 200 #1 UK album chart (1964) Columbia Records
Deserted Ballroom - The Jay Gordon Concert Orchestra Featured on their Music From Another World album Tops Records
Louie Louie - The Kingsmen Request from @tiredhippo #2 US Billboard Hot 100 #26 UK singles chart (1964) #55 Rolling Stone 500 Greatest Songs of All Time Jerden Records/Wand Records
I Wanna Be Your Man - The Rolling Stones #12 UK singles chart Decca Records B-side to US-only single of Not Fade Away #48 US Billboard Hot 100 London Records
Be My Baby - The Ronettes #2 US Billboard Hot 100 #4 UK singles chart #22 Rolling Stone’s 500 Greatest Songs of All Time From their only studio album, Presenting the Fabulous Ronettes #96 US Billboard 200 Philles Records

item.title: RadioNowhere's Best of 2011
item.description: The staff of RadioNowhere.org unveil their choices for the Best of 2011.
item.itunes:subtitle: The staff of RadioNowhere.org unveil their choices for the Best of 2011.
item.itunes:summary:
RadioNowhere's Best of 2011 19.December.2011 www.radionowhere.org
Tweet us! @radionowhereuk @lairdofnowhere @bigifdj @jessica6uk @timtenyen @LibraryOfSound @ChickyBoilUps @FilmicRadio @jessieluvaction @HipAuntie @PineyGir
Compiled by the staff at RadioNowhere.org: Bigif, Ley Bricknell, Patrick Burke, Rachel Devlin, Piney Gir, Jessica 6, Christopher Laird, Judy Neuhaus, Tim Ten Yen, Peta Waddington, Jessie Ward O’Sullivan & Ruby Wright.
‘If it’s good, they’ll find it’ ~ The New York Times
‘Songs from the best new independent artists’ ~ The Guardian
RadioNowhere’s Song of the Year - LA FEMME: Sur La Planche
RadioNowhere’s Album of the Year - BEARSUIT: The Phantom Forest
RadioNowhere’s Promotional Video of the Year - PAPA TOPO: La Chica Vampira
(complete running order)
BRITISH SEA POWER: Who’s In Control (Rough Trade)
